key_points: Lauren Cho, a 30-year-old woman from New Jersey, went missing in Yucca Valley, Southern California at the end of June.
Her case has seen renewed interest following the media coverage and outcome of the Gabby Petito case.
The Riverside County Sheriff's Department joined the search, pursuing leads from family and friends.
Cho was last seen walking away from her residence in Yucca Valley; she has not been found despite being reported missing.
She was wearing a yellow T-shirt and jean shorts on the day of her disappearance.
Cho was visiting California from New Jersey when she disappeared, with few details available about the circumstances.
An aerial search and a search warrant execution at the last known location involved canines but the outcomes remain unclear.
Public and social media commentary has highlighted a perceived disparity in the urgency and coverage between Cho's and Petito's cases.
Gabby Petito's case involved widespread media attention and resulted in the discovery of her body; her death was ruled a homicide.
Authorities encourage anyone with information about Lauren Cho to contact Detective Edward Hernandez or Sergeant Justin Giles.
